result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Francis Bender was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence serving at the present

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution to Capital One in the amount of $286.18.
Pay restitution to Cooper Oil in the amount of $221.83.
Hold open restitution for 30 days.
Restitution is to be paid out of prison account.

Pay costs and DNA Surcharge. 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Complete a psycological assessment and comply with recommendations.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places: WDurant, MDurant, JGibson, Cooper Oil or their family members, residence or  
Do not have access, sell or buy anything from Craigslist or any type of similar website.
Do not possess a bank account and/or credit card and/or loan without prior agent permission. 
Must sign release of information form as required by agent so agent has access to account information. 
Do not possess more than one checking and/or one savings account and/or loan unless its pre-approved by the agent.
May only possess one email address. Provide email address to agent.
Do not possess any more than one cell phone unless you have your agent's prior permission.
Do not go by any name other than Michael F. Bender Jr. for the duration of supervision.
Maintain absolute sobriety for duration of supervision.
Complete a psycological assessment and comply with recommendations.
Comply with any other assesments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Sign release of information forms for offender's assessments and/or treatment.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.

AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 07-28-2015 11:00 am

3:16 p.m. Defendant Michael Francis Bender in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Michael Francis Bender in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 14CF305 cts 1-6 to DRI and Ct 7 & 8 to plea to and PSI Report requested.  14CM42 to be DRI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF305 Cts 7 & 8: No Contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF305 cts 7 & 8.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 14CF305 ct 1-6 and 14CM42 are dismissed and Read in.

BY THE COURT:
PSI Report is ordered.

Atty Erik McFarland Motions the Court on Bond Modification to amend down to a signature bond.
ADA Cousins states objections to motion.
BY THE COURT: Motion to modify bond is denied.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.
